Key Match Events: Austin Reaves scored 35 points, nearly achieving a triple-double with 10 assists and 9 rebounds.
Jarrett Allen posted a double-double with 27 points and 14 rebounds, along with three blocks, an assist, and a steal.
Donovan Mitchell added 26 points on 8-of-20 shooting, including 6-of-13 from the three-point line.
Cleveland started the game strong, leading by double digits, 29-14, in the first quarter.
The Lakers cut the lead to three points, 30-33, after a floater by LeBron James.
Cleveland turned a 77-75 advantage into an 87-78 lead heading into the final quarter after a three-pointer by Caris LeVert.
The Cavaliers maintained separation with a 9-2 run to start the fourth quarter, pushing the lead to 16 points, 96-80, after a triple by Georges Niang.
The Lakers reduced the lead to five points, 107-112, with 2:50 left after a three-pointer by LeBron James.
Back-to-back-to-back shots by Jarrett Allen kept Los Angeles at bay, 118-107, with 1:28 remaining, securing the win for Cleveland.
